Articles.Content: Yea.. thats why I asked today about a blank chassis with no wheels. I figured that would make more sense than asking for them to be repaired. I never thought it would catalyses in Bobcat appointing someone to fix the old mods lol.
Turned out for the best they are so popular

Well, it's a bit more complicated, some of those unfinished parts have real issues which require a bit of know-how to fix. That said, ISS will soon (I hope) be re-released, then (maybe) updated with a better, Infernal Robotics-based truss on a latter date. HOME3 had some serious issues, but I've already fixed a large amount of them (not all, though, the crew vehicle is still barely usable). I'm not giving any dates yet, though. There's good stuff coming, and it's gonna get a new thread.

Also, I recall there being a community patch for the old HOME parts, but I can't find it. Could someone send it my way? It might be useful to update those, too, while we're at it. Just not the DEMVs, since they have wheels that use the old system and are thus impossible to directly port to the new KSP.

Well if you are going to get the ISS released you better also hurry up with getting CSS to 100%!
I believe Dragon has studies so he will be balancing that and ksp would be my guess
Can't you just separate the DEMV chassis and wheels into separate parts and apply the squad wheel system to the wheels?
Yes it would be IF you have any skill with 3d modeling. All Ive got is half-assed courses for Auto CAD 2004 from a vocational school... Thats why I asked if anyone else could do it lmao.
I can separate the parts easily enough.

That's more than just splitting up the parts. You also need to set them up in Unity. It's easier to make a new rover, really.

And yeah, I've got studies to do. That means that work is really gonna take off in the second half of June. That said, I should be done with the easy things (fixing the current issues) and the CSS before the end of may. The latter, in particular, requires just a bunch of tweaks to the landing gear.

There is a plugin for blender that mihara wrote that allows you to pull the Mu file in which gives you the 3d drawing would this help in changing the wheels I guess stuff would need to be retextured and pushed through unity again
Where can I download the new DEMV mod?

I'm testing the HOME command module and it seems to have an invisible parachute. When I deploy the parachute, it slows the vehicle, but does not show up onscreen. Anyone else have this issue or can point me in the right direction for a resolution?
